summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from June-July 2020 between a Special Agent from the FBI's New York Field Office (Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking) and attorneys from Edwards Pottinger LLC. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with victims of Jeffrey Epstein and a request for verification documents (302s) related to victim interviews.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.role: Trial Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC
persons.context: She is the primary attorney corresponding with an FBI Special Agent to schedule interviews for her clients (Epstein victims) and requests verification documents.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is copied on all email correspondence regarding the scheduling of victim interviews with the FBI.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: She is copied on all email correspondence regarding the scheduling of victim interviews with the FBI.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The agent is coordinating with victim attorneys to schedule interviews with Epstein victims and is the recipient of a request for interview verification documents (302s).

connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: Attorney and FBI agent communicating to schedule victim interviews and discuss obtaining official documentation.
Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC, with Edwards copied on all relevant correspondence.
Both are staff at Edwards Pottinger LLC, with Kelljchian copied on all relevant correspondence.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
connections.description: FBI agent keeps attorney Edwards informed by copying him on scheduling emails.

events.title: Proposed Victim Interview Date
events.description: Attorney Brittany Henderson initially proposes Monday, June 29, 2020, as a date for the FBI Special Agent to speak with victims.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

events.title: Scheduling Coordination for Victim Interviews
events.description: A series of emails over several weeks where an FBI agent and victim attorneys work to find a mutually agreeable time to conduct interviews with Epstein victims.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

locations: Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301 (Edwards Pottinger LLC office at 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2)
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking task force in New York was actively interviewing victims of Jeffrey Epstein as of June-July 2020.
Attorneys from Edwards Pottinger LLC represent multiple Epstein victims and were coordinating interviews with the FBI.
Attorney Brittany Henderson requested "302's or another form of verification" from the FBI, indicating a need for official documentation that victims had been interviewed.

The correspondence shows professional coordination between law enforcement and victim attorneys, with scheduling challenges due to the agent being "swamped" and the attorney having trouble "coordinating with one of the girls."
